definitions.definition: a thing that looks like a fine thread growing on the leaves and stems of some plants
to annoy somebody by always being near them, asking them questions, etc.

to relax and enjoy yourself, especially in a lively way

definitions.definition: to not hurt somebody physically in any way
to look extremely clean and neat
not to see somebody/something for some time

examples.text: I haven't seen hide nor hair of her for a month.

definitions.definition: to show no surprise, shock, etc. when something unusual or unexpected happens

examples.text: She listened to his confession without turning a hair.

definitions.definition: to pay too much attention in an argument to differences that are very small and not important
to show that you are very angry or anxious about something

examples.text: She's keeping very calm—anyone else would be tearing their hair out.
I felt like tearing my hair out in frustration.

wordOrigin: Old English hǣr, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch haar and German Haar.
